intro: Ischaemum tropicum, commonly known as tropical ischaemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, spike-like inflorescences produce tiny flowers that are often greenish or pale yellow in color. Ischaemum tropicum is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
